metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5124 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect application of sandboxing in Blink in Google Chrome prior to62.0.3202.62 allowed a remote attacker to inject arbitrary scripts or HTML(UXSS) via a crafted MHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.16.04.1308').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
